gurmukhi: dwnv sYn lKY blvwn su bwhin cMif pRcMif BRmwno ]
transliteration: Daanav Sain Lakhai Balvaan Su Baahan(i) Channd(i) Prachanndd(i) Bhramaano||
translation: Seeing the powerful forces of the demons, Chandi revolved the lion’s face swiftly.

gurmukhi: ckR Alwq kI bwq bGUrn CqR nhI sm Aau Krswno ]
transliteration: Chakra Alaat Koo Baat Baghooran Chhatra Nahoo Sam Au Kharsaano||
translation: Even the disc, wind, canopy nd grindstone cannot revolve so swiftly.

gurmukhi: qwrn mwih su AYso iPirE jl Baur nhI sr qwih bKwno ]
transliteration: Taaran Maah(i) Su Aiso Phirio Jal Bhaur Nahoo Sar Taah(i) Bakhaano||
translation: The lion hath revolved in that battlefield in such a way that even the whirlwind cannot compete with it.

gurmukhi: Aaur nhI aupmw aupjY su duhUM ruKu kyhir kY suiK mwno ]211]
transliteration: Aur Nahoo Oupmaa Oupjai Su Duhoon Roukh(u) Kehar(i) Kai Moukh(i) Maano||211||
translation: The can be no other comparison except that the face of the lion may be considered on both the sides of his body.211.

gurmukhi: ju`Du mhwN AwsurM gin swiQ BieE qb cMf pRcMfih BwrI ]
transliteration: Juddh(u) Mahaan Asuran Gad(i) Saath(i) Bhaio Tab Channd Prachannddah(i) Bhdaroo||
translation: At that time the powerful Chandi had fought a great war with huge gathering of demons.

gurmukhi: sYn Apwr hkwr suDwr ibdwr sMGwr deI rn kwrI ]
transliteration: Sain Apaar Hakaar Sudhaar Bidaar Sanhaar Daoo Ran Kdaroo||
translation: Challenging the unaccountable army, chastening and awakening it, Kali had destroyed it in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: Kyq BieE qhw cwr sau kos lau so aupmw kiv dyiK ibcwrI ]
transliteration: Kher Bhaio Tahaa Chaar Sau Kos Lau So Oupmaa Kav(i) Dkh(i) Bichdaroo||
translation: The war was fought there upto four hundred kos and the poet hath imagined it like this:

gurmukhi: pUrn eyk GrI n prI ij igry Dr pY br ijau piq JwrI ]212]
transliteration: Pooran Ek Gdaroo Na Daroo Jig Ire Dhar Pai Bar Jio Pat(i) Jhdaroo||212||
translation: Only one ghari (small duration of time) was not complete, when the demons had fallen on the earth like the leaves (of trees) in autumn.212.

gurmukhi: mwr cmUM cqurMg leI qb lIno hY suMB cmuMf ko Awgw ]
transliteration: Maar Chamoond Chaturan Laoo Tab Loono Hai Sounbh Chamounnd Ko Aagad||
translation: When all the four divisions of army were killed, Sumbh marched forward to obstruct the advance of Chandi.

gurmukhi: cwl pirE AvnI isgrI hir jU hir Awsin qy auiT Bwgw ]
transliteration: Dhaal Pario Avnoo Sigroo Har(i) Aasan(i) Te Outh(i) Bhaagad||
translation: At that time the whole earth shook and Shiva rose and ran from his seat of contemplation.

gurmukhi: sUK gieE qRs kY hir hwir su sMkiq AMk mhwN BieE jwgw ]
transliteration: Sookh Gado Tras Kai Har(i) Daar(i) Su Sankat(i) Ank Mahaan Bhaio Jaagad||
translation: The necklace (snake) of Shiva’s throat had withered because of fear, it trembled because of great fear in his heart.

gurmukhi: lwg rihE lptwie gry miD mwnhu muMf kI mwl ko qwgw ]213]
transliteration: Laag Rahio Laptaae Dare Madh(i) Maanoh Mounnd Koo Maal Ko Taagad||213||
translation: That snake clinging to Shiva’s throat appears like the string of the wreath of skulls.213.

gurmukhi: cMif ky swmuih Awie kY suMB kihE muiK so ieh mY sB jwnI ]
transliteration: Channd(i) Ke Saamuh(i) Aae Kai Sounbh Kahio Moukh(i) So Eh Mai Sabh Jaanoo||
translation: Coming in front of Chandi, the demon Sumbh uttered from his mouth: “I have come to know all this.
